turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Marcee --

turns.speaker: MARCEE
turns.text: What DO you stand for???

turns.speaker: MARCEE
turns.text: I'm sorry what I said back there.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Don't be silly.

turns.speaker: MARCEE
turns.text: My husband believes in you.  We're gonna make it.  Bye bye Dorothy.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: He took a shot.  He's unconscious.

turns.speaker: MARCEE
turns.text: I'm freakin out.  Oh God I'm --

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Keep the phone open.  I'll call back. Stay calm. He's got some good doctors out there.

turns.speaker: MARCEE
turns.text: "Stay calm?"  I'm freakin...

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Alright, I'm freaking too.  But they need you to stay calm.  I'll call back. _ 124.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Dooler, you know Bob Sugar.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: The best commercial director in the business.  I hail you.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Cronin's okay for lunch?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Marcee -- this is one of our agents. This is Bob Sugar, who needs to learn to knock.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Pleasure.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Gimme a second here... Tidwell... Arizona contract... new glass cabinet...

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'm fine.  What's up?

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: I came here to let you go. _ 27.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Pardon me?

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Came here to fire you, Jerry.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Aw shit...the crowded restaurant... so there's no scene...

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: I know.  It sucks.  I suck.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You...

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: You did this to yourself.  You said "fewer clients."  You put it all on paper.  Scully was very upset.  Heart attacks make some people sweeter, but not him.  You did this to yourself --

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: ... dick?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Dick.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Give me a little credit for doing this face-to-face!  What I went through knowing I was going to do this to my mentor!  Can you get past yourself for a second?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You'll lose.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: You wanted smaller.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'm over it.  Now I want all my clients and yours too.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: Jerry --

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: -- and I'll get 'em.

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: You'll always be my hero, Jerry. Always always always.  We're bringing other elements in, we're focusing on endorsements -- it's not about handholding anymore. We're no longer babysitters --

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: SMI represents all three quarterbacks on your team, where's their loyalty going to be?  You stay with me, I'd fight for YOU alone.  You'd be my only client on that team...

turns.speaker: SUGAR
turns.text: I've got the clients.  I've got the juice.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: One-two-three, swing.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Thanks.  May I offer you both a ride?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Hey, man, you know they have big balloons built into cars?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: They do, my brother.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'm not your brother!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Hi Ray.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: And then my dad died and my mom took me to the zoo and I love the zoo. Do you hate the zoo or do you love the zoo?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Wait.  I want to tell you more about my dad.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Let's go the zoo.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Okay.  I've been hogging it. You're right.  _ 76.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Let's go right now.  Let's go to the zoo.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Aw, the fucking thing... I mean, the zoo is closed.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You said "fuck".

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yeah I know.  I did.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I won't tell.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: We'll go to the zoo sometime. Okay? I think I might have some time on my hands.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I don't see any.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Funny.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Funny...   I better go to bed.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What's going on, Jerry?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: A lot.  We got a big fax today... we need this commission, buddy.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Show me the animal, Jerry!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Right up ahead, buddy --

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: -- I give you my favorite animal in the zoo.  Are you ready for the weirdness, the strange perfection and truth of...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'm scared.  What is it?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: It's in a cage.  Do not be scared of...

turns.speaker: MARCEE
turns.text: Now go kiss your daddy, quick.

turns.speaker: TEE PEE
turns.text: That's why they cheer, you know. The white man sending the black man into battle...

turns.speaker: TEE PEE
turns.text: He's gonna have nothing left for next season.  They're letting him kill himself.

turns.speaker: MARCEE
turns.text: Can you be quiet?

turns.speaker: TEE PEE
turns.text: What'd I say?

turns.speaker: TEE PEE
turns.text: He should have kept his head tucked down.

turns.speaker: MARCEE
turns.text: Shut up!!!

turns.speaker: TEE PEE
turns.text: I'm not putting him down, I just have a commitment to the truth.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: ERRR-IIIC!

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: And tell your wife to stop making so much noise! We're food to these damn animals.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Still, you have survived the dinosaurs before. You saved those kids.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: A few of us survived. A lot more died. And we were better prepared and better armed.  How many days have they been missing?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: After what you've seen today, you really think your son could be alive?

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: He's smart, Dr. Grant. And he knows so much about dinosaurs.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Eric!

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Quiet!

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: This is how you make dinosaurs?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: This is how you play God.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Do you think it goes all the way across?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: One way to find out.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Oh, my God.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: A bird cage.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: First off let me say as a dinosaur enthusiasts, Amanda and I have admired your work for years.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: It is truly, whats the word? Inspiring.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Amanda and I, well, we just love the outdoors. Heck we've been on pretty much any adventure tour they can come up with: Galapagos, K2, the Nile...

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: We even have two seats reserved aboard the first commercial moon flight.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: ...once-in-a-lifetime.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: We've arranged for a private airplane to take us flying over Isla Sorna. And we want you to be our guide.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Well, I'm no aviation specialist. But I do know it's hell of a lot lower than anyone else.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: From what I understand, it's pretty much whatever we want.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Amanda, Honey! Dr. Grant says it's a bad idea!

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: He says it's a bad idea!

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: What's a bad idea?

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: We can't just...

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Don't worry, honey. We'll circle around and come back.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Her new boyfriend.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: A friend. We were vacationing. Eric wanted to see the island and the dinosaurs, so Ben found a guy who would take them parasailing. They never came back.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: We called everyone, did everything we could. Because of all the controversy over this island, no one will step in. Costa Rica says it's a no-fly zone, it's their own damn fault. Guys at the U.S Embassy -- our U.S. Embassy -- said we should "accept the inevitable." You believe that?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Nothing you haven't seen before.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: How much weight have you lost?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Twenty, twenty-fire pounds. I've been swimming at the Y.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: You hate to swim.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: People change.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: You look good.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: So do you.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Stop that. Dr. Grant says this is dangerous territory.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Well we should split up or something. We can cover twice the area.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: No, Dr. Grant says...

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Dr. Grant says this, Dr. Grant says that...

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Well what's the use of hiring an expert if your not going to listen to him?

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Because "Dr. Grant" isn't looking for Eric. Dr. Grant is looking for the coast.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Fine...and when the Tricyclatops comes after you, don't come crying to me.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Oh, don't worry about that.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What did you say?

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What did you say!

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Just drop it Paul!

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Young adult.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Eric...

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: That's him. Thats Eric!

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: I filmed this the morning they left.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I'm sorry Amanda. I am. And I'm sorry for the things I said about him.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: No, it's...

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I know you liked Ben. I had no right to...

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Its not about him. It's Eric. He's alone out here somewhere. Our baby is all alone.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Eric! Are you here?

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Eric!

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Udesky.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: He's this way.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: It's not safe.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: We have to help him.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: We can't just stop looking. Eric and Dr. Grant are out there somewhere.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I want to find them too, but we can't do a bit of good right now. For every scary thing we saw in the daylight, I'll bet there ten times more of 'em at night.  Am I right?

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Well what?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Well damn it. I don't speak ill of the dead. What I'm trying to say is, its was just a crazy accident. The exact same thing could have happened if he was with me. You can't go beating yourself up about it.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: This wouldn't happen if he was with you. I mean, you drive five miles below the speed limit. I totaled three cars in fives years.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: That one time was just the bumper.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: He would have been, safe. Completely, entirely, suffocatingly safe.  I would have him to see more of the world than Enid, Oklahoma. I wanted to see more of the world than Enid, Oklahoma. And so yes, it's my fault that this happened. I'm sorry that you have to be here.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I don't know. I don't have it with me.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: When did you have it last?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I don't remember

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Think.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: What?...WHAT!?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I loaned it to Nash. He must have had it on him when he...

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Sweetheart, you're okay.  You're okay.  You're okay.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Never had a doubt. Never did. Us Kirby men, we stick around, huh?

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Eric, its okay. You'll be right behind me.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: We're not going anywhere, I promise.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Paul! Where is he? Can you see him?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I'm trying! That thing took him down this way!

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: My own kid was right in front of me and I didn't do a damn thing.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: You couldn't have made that jump.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I should have tried. It should have been me on that beach back there, not Billy.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: How would you have helped Eric?  He needs you, Paul. He needs us.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: He could have died.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: But he didn't. And neither did you. And I'm glad about that.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: We should try fishing again.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: You mean it?

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: I do. It's worth another shot. And who knows? Things might turn out differently.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Either that, or the government will firebomb it back to the Stone Age.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: I would completely support that.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: You see, that's just the thing. Paul and I have special permission to fly low.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: How low?

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: He's with a man named Ben Hildebrand.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Who's that?

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: I thought we weren't suppose to yell.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Here!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: He's right. A predator wouldn't leave a kill wounded.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: He's not a kill, he's still alive.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: We need to stick to the plan. Head for the coast.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: What about Eric and Dr. Grant?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Going to the coast was Alan's idea. If he's alive, thats where he's headed.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: What about Eric?

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: You had the phone the whole time?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Where is it?

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: PAUL!

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: DAD!

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Where's Dad?

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Just hold on.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: We have to keep looking for Dad. We have to.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: I know. I know. I want to look for him too.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: then we should...

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Let me tell you a few things about you Dad, okay? He's very very very clever, very very brave, and he loves you ever very much.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: He loves you too.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Okay. He loves us very very much. And I know that right now more than anything, your Dad would want to know that we're safe. Okay?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: That was Isla Nublar. This is Isla Sorna. The second island.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I didn't know, there were two islands.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: So Mr. Kirby, tell me, when you climbed K2, did you base camp at 25- or 30,000 feet?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Thirty-thousand, I think. Closer to the top.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: About a thousand feet above it, actually.  Most mountain-climbers remember how tall that mountains were.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: They couldnt climb up, so they were trying to get us to come down.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: They set a trap  They actually set a trap.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I dont know.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I thought you were an expert.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Dr. Grant was.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: He's probably has a better chance by the coast as it is. Figures that all the big dinosaurs would live in the center of the island.  Right?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Eric!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: It won't hold!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: How was your trip? Profitable?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: We'll be broke in four weeks.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Three weeks. I had to rent some equipment.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: You rented an automated litter box.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: It's a rapid prototyper. I feed in the scan data from the raptor skull, than the computer breaks it into thousands of slices which this thing prints, one layer on top of the other. It's the future of paleontology.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Not if it can't dig.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Absolutely not.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: They're here.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Even with what I pay you, you could get a better bag.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: No way. This is lucky. Couple years ago some buddies and I went hang gliding off these cliffs in New Zealand. Updraft sent me right into the side. BOOM!

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: That does sound lucky.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: It was this strap alone that saved my life. Got caught on a rock as I was falling.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Reverse-Darwinism. Survival of the most idiotic.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Listen Alan, I really appreciate you bringing me along.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: The bones will be there when we get back. That's the nice thing about them. They never run away.  And besides, you got me into this. I don't intend to be alone with these people.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I'm so use to seeing bones. It's weird to see skin.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Mr. and Mrs. Kirby! If you look out the right you can see...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Is it a rex?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: How would you classify it?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Obviously a superpredator.  Suchimimus. that snout.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: They never got that big.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Baryonyx?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Not with that sail.  Spinosaurus Aegypticus.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I don't remember that on InGen's list.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: That's because it wasn't on their list. Who knows what else they were up to?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: It looks intact.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: We should take it with us to signal any planes.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: We could co-write a paper.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Ah yes, the first rule of academics. Publish or perish.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: ALAN!

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: KEEP GOING!

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: We need to keep moving.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Alan, I want to tell you that I'm so sorry about the...

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Billy, I can't talk to you now.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: You have to believe me. I did it with the best intentions.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Some of the worst things imaginable have been done with the best intentions. You rushed in with no thought to the consequences, to yourself or anyone else.  You're no better than the people who built this place.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I CAN GET HIM!

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: NO!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I KNOW THE CONSEQUENCES!

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Hmm?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: He's three. Why don't you wait till he's a little older?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: He used to know me.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Sorry, Alan it's been six years.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: So, Mark's working at the State Department now.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Really?  What do you do there?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Anything good?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Raptors, mostly.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: My favorite.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: You remember the sounds they made?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: I try not to.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: We've done cranial scans, and raptors actually had a quite sophisticated resonating chamber. I have a theory that their ability to vocalize is the key to their social intelligence. The way they can work together as a team.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: You think they could talk to each other?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: To a degree we never imagined.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Good luck with the fund raising.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: It was never easy, but before Jurassic Park, you could find money. Somewhere. Now fossils are out. Everyone wants to see a real live dinosaur.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Times change Alan. But you're the still the best. I mean that.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: The last of my breed.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: I'd better get going.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Let me know if I can help, Alan. Youre bad about asking for help, but please ask me. Anything, anytime.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Okay. Goodbye, Ellie.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Goodbye, Alan.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: When I met you, I thought that one day millions of years ago, all the dinosaurs became extinct. Wiped out. But you told me otherwise. When conditions changed, dinosaurs changed. They became other things. They evolved.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: A well-accepted theory.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Alan don't be afraid to evolve.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Eric, your parents are both here.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: In Costa Rica?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: On the island.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: They'll never make it. I mean, they can't manage when the cable goes out.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: You'd be surprised what people can do when they have too.
